required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Infusion Versus Intermittent Boluses of Cisatracurium in the Early Management of Pediatric ARDS
clinical_study.official_title: Continuous Infusion Versus Intermittent Boluses of Cisatracurium in the Early Management of Pediatric Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this work is to compare continuous infusion vs on need intermittent boluses of Cisatracurium in the early management of pediatric acute respiratory distress syndrome

detailed_description.textblock: In the pediatric population, Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) has a high mortality rate of approximately 24%. In addition, there is a lack of high-quality data to guide the use of non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents (NMBAs) in mechanically ventilated children. Hence, there is a need to evaluate its use in pediatrics.

primary_outcome.description: Time from patient's intubation till extubation

secondary_outcome.description: Time from start of ventilation till discharge from PICU
Time from start of ventilation till discharge from hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: Organ failure free days to day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Organ failure according to SOFA scores
Oxygenation Index/Oxygen saturation index on study days 1, 3, 7
All children died after mechanical ventilation till day 28
Assessing serum interleukin 8 on admission and after 48 hours
Development of pneumothorax during mechanical ventilation

clinical_study.condition: Acute Lung Injury/Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)

arm_group.description: Thirty children with ARDS will be managed with intermittent boluses of Cisatracurium (0.1-0.15 mg/kg/dose).
Thirty children with ARDS will be treated with intravenous infusion of Cisatracurium titrated from 1 mic/kg/min till reaching the desired effect for 24 hours.

intervention.description: Thirty children with ARDS will be treated with intermittent boluses of Cisatracurium (0.1-0.15 mg/kg/dose).

intervention.intervention_name: Intravenous infusion of Cisatracurium for 24 hours
intervention.description: Thirty children with ARDS will be treated with intravenous infusion of Cisatracurium titrated from 1 mic/kg/min till reaching the desired effect for 24 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Children with mild, moderate, and severe ARDS diagnosed according to criteria of Pediatric Acute Lung Injury Consensus Conference (PALICC) in 2015.
2. Children of both sexes aged from one month to 18 years.
3. Children diagnosed with ARDS <48 hours before enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Continuous neuromuscular blockade at enrollment
2. Children on phenytoin and carbamazepine
3. Severe liver cirrhosis
4. High-risk medical illness (Bone marrow transplantation within the last one-year, Diffuse alveolar hemorrhage from vasculitis, Chronic respiratory failure, Burns > 70% total body surface)
5. Previous hypersensitivity or anaphylactic reaction to Cisatracurium
6. Neuromuscular conditions that may potentiate neuromuscular blockade and/or impair effective spontaneous ventilation

patient_data.ipd_description: The data will be available upon reasonable request from the principal investigator
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: for one year after completion of the study
